author: Special Correspondent
text:
The State Government’s Revenue Department staff launched a two-day stir on Tuesday to highlight their 21-point charter of demands including scrapping of the contributory pension scheme, filling up existing vacancies that exceed 10,000 among other issues.

An estimated 375 staff of the 566 did not report for duty on Tuesday in Thanjavur district as a result of which the government offices wore a deserted look.

In Tiruvarur district, 373 Revenue Department staff, including 120 women, participated in the stir by abstaining from duty because of which office work was disturbed in Tiruvarur, Mannargudi, and Tiruthuraipoondi areas.
title: Revenue staff launch strike
